attributes.trait_type: large head of sour cabbage or fresh cabbage

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

If using fresh cabbage, core it and blanch in boiling water for 5-8 minutes until leaves are pliable. For sour cabbage, soak in cold water for at least an hour if too salty.
Carefully separate the leaves, trim the thick veins, and set aside.

Prepare the Filling:

Cook the rice until almost done and let it cool.
In a skillet, sauté the chopped onion in vegetable oil until translucent. Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, cooked rice, sautéed onions, egg, dill, thyme, smoked paprika, salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Mix well.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place about 1-2 tablespoons of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Fold the sides over the filling and roll tightly, tucking in the ends.

Assemble the Dish:

In a large pot or Dutch oven, spread half of the sauerkraut on the bottom.
Arrange the stuffed cabbage rolls on top of the sauerkraut.
Add the chopped bacon, bay leaves, and peppercorns between the layers.
Cover the rolls with the remaining sauerkraut and pour the tomato juice over everything. Add water if necessary to ensure the rolls are covered.

Cook:

Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Transfer the pot to the oven and bake, uncovered, for an additional 1 hour.

Serve:

Serve hot, with a dollop of sour cream on top.
